properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A disturbance tracking northeastward across Hudson Bay will bring wet snow and strong winds to the Kimmirut region. Flurries, already in the region today, could produce a few centimetres of snow. However tonight, as the system approaches the Hudson Strait, the snow will become more organized. Snowfall accumulations of 5 to 10 cm will be possible although amounts will be highly dependent on surface temperatures and whether the snow becomes mixed with rain. A few more centimetres of wet snow are possible on Tuesday before gradually tapering off late in the day. In addition to the snow, strong southeasterly winds will also develop tonight, gusting at times to 70 km/h, before moderating Tuesday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-06T00:28:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-05T08:29:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2850994659.2020
Area: Kimmirut
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in areas prone to frost overnight Sunday. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-05T13:59:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-05T03:41:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3918209778.2020
Area: Alma - Desbiens area, Saint-Félicien - Roberval area, Falardeau - Mont-Valin area, Sainte-Rose-du-Nord area, Ville de Saguenay area, Rivière-Éternité - Petit-Saguenay area, Tadoussac - Baie-Sainte-Catherine area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Dense fog is reducing visibility to near zero in some locations this morning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-05T16:59:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-05T08:23:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1774072128.2020
Area: Simcoe - Delhi - Norfolk, Dunnville - Caledonia - Haldimand, London - Parkhill - Eastern Middlesex County, St. Thomas - Aylmer - Eastern Elgin County, Woodstock - Tillsonburg - Oxford County, Brantford - County of Brant
properties.Author: Environment Canada
